title: I was ban but was it judgemental leave a comment how it should be proper done.
body:
So what happen in game was that I was playing Blitzcrank as a support, we were doing really good after the first enemy ganked. Then we request a ganked from our jungler player which was Master Yi. So about 10-15 minutes later, no sign of him coming to help and we were getting shut down really bad because enemy jungle Twitch came back and ganked back to back really bad. Things started to get heated due to our jungler Master Yi refuse to help ganked. So I started to be toxic and our jungler was making excuse that he couldn't find a time to ganked for 10-15 minutes and say he was busy getting rift herald but at the same time he wanders off to enemy jungles. And all those time he say he couldn't find anytime. Master Yi haven't ganked mid but only top once and that's it. So we all lost lane due to enemy ganking lanes back to back. Also through out the game Master Yi has the rift herald and didn't use it through out the game. Pretty sure he's making excuse that he couldn't find time using rift herald through out the game

Here's the chat with Riots banning me.

Then I might as well do that for every game because it kinda seems to enjoyable for the player to get them mad and you here to waste other player time and report them for being BM and they get the penalty for it. Right now it seems corrupted by the ways how Riots sets the penalty for it just for being BM and the penalty for it and player who ruins the game for them does not gets it.

I know these can be subjective concepts. I myself was once banned for calling my teammates “weak, fleshy underlings.” Even though I meant well, enough of them reported me for it that I re-programmed my communication style. By acting diplomatic and calm, I’m now able to bend them to my will without succumbing to the forbidden dance of verbal abuse.
Sometimes it’s best to ignore the mewlings of your teammates and only focus on what you can control. If teammates anger you, try saying so out loud to yourself, not in chat where they can report you. After an annoying game, find a satisfying way to blow off steam. I’m told humans find catharsis in music, so try listening to Mozart or the dulcet sounds of “LET THE BODIES HIT THE FLOOR.”

October 9th 2018, 12:49:36 am
Hey there T O P Senpai,
SanguineDogma here with the Player Support Team, and it'd be my pleasure to help you out today!
I totally understand that other players in this game can be vicious and tilting and negative, but that doesn't give us justification to respond to their behavior with negativity of our own. Looking over your account, I can see that this 2 week ban was placed on your account because of your decision to use homophobic slurs.
We take homophobic slurs very seriously, as those words are steeped in years of hatred, and the community just doesn't want to see them being used in games. Just because they aren't hurtful to you doesn't mean that other people in game will share your same sentiments. We have a strict Zero-Tolerance policy for the use of any kind of slur, racial, homophobic, or otherwise. The first offense for language like this warrants an immediate 2-Week ban, which placed your account on very thin ice. Any further instances of negativity, no matter how minor, are very likely to result in your account being banned permanently.
In the future, I highly recommend muting players in-game when they're exhibiting behavior that upsets you, and then remembering to report them at the end of the game.
If you have any other questions or concerns, feel free to let me know! I'm always here to help.

SanguineDogma
